file_content.text: There's talk that some of the Rattataki are wanting to join us, and the rest are giving us a wide berth. Well done.
It's done--the machines, the Rattataki leadership, all of it. I took care of them.
Excellent. I knew you were the perfect person for the job. I should have sent a holo crew to record it.
The Rattataki will give us a wide berth after your little demonstration.
I haven't had a fight like that in a while. Maybe I should pay Rattatak a visit.
The attack went perfectly.
Yes, of course. Thank you for your help.
Those savages are still trying to figure out what happened.
The attack went perfectly.
I'm saddened that I couldn't watch it personally. Thank you for you help, you're an inspiration.
Anyone in my place would have done the same thing.
I did what had to be done.
Perhaps, but without your flair. In the future, you should take more pride in your work.
I'm done with the Rattataki.
Of course. Thank you for helping us this time; because of you, we'll be able to handle it ourselves.
I hope you're just resupplying--as long as the Rattataki have the machinery to create weapons, they remain a threat.
You're only half-done. The leaders will just repair the factory if you don't kill them. We must break them utterly.
This Republic unit was destroyed as well, sir. No survivors.
I was hoping they'd wipe each other out. Notify me if you hear anything else.
Operative Bator tells me you've done pretty well against the Rattataki before; well, they're back, and this time they've gone too far.
Excellent, I don't have to look for you. The local Rattataki--the former prisoners, not you--need to be taught a lesson.
Glad you're here. The Rattataki--the wildest alien prisoners in the Republic's little zoo--have finally overstepped their bounds.
The savages have claimed the planet for themselves, call it New Rattatak. They say they'll kill everyone, Republic and Empire alike.
They're no match for Imperial troops. They can't hold out for long.
Hardly a serious threat.
They've taken a factory and started making weapons--what they lack in skill they make up for in initiative.
This is why they don't take prisoners on Rattatak.
That's my species, all right.
These aren't normal Rattataki--whatever happened here turned them into psychotics, and now they've captured a weapons factory to arm themselves.
Anyone willing to kill Republic troops can't be all bad.
They could be a valuable ally.
They aren't looking to negotiate; they're looking to commit genocide. They've taken a factory and are arming themselves.
You'd think they'd have learned their lesson by now.
They're still around?
They've learned, all right--learned they need weapons. They've taken a factory and started arming themselves.
And I care why?
They're a threat to everyone on Belsavis. They've converted a factory, and they're using it to make weapons.
Right now, they're content to slaughter the Republic, but once they've stockpiled enough armaments we'll be next on their dance card.
I know how they think. I'll take care of this situation.
I'll take care of this.
They're all yours, but don't confuse your loyalties--these savages only want more bloodshed. You'll find their factory on the upper grounds.
The Rattataki need to be put in their place--I'll take care of them myself.
I'll see to this personally.
I'm certain it will be terrible to behold. You can find their factory in the upper grounds of the compound.
What are they arming themselves with?
About these armaments....
Crude blades mostly, but they scavenge weapons off their victims, too. They're masters of ambush--they don't fear us or the Republic.
This is why you sought me out?
I need someone who can deal with them in terms they understand.
The Rattataki only respect strength and ferocity; areas in which I understand you excel.
The Rattataki feel safe, feel confident. They need to learn that the Empire can reach anywhere.
The Rattataki think their leadership is untouchable, that nothing can stop them. They need to be proven wrong.
We need someone to kill their leadership, wreck their little factory and put those aliens in their place. I respectfully request your assistance.
They will regret their arrogance. Leave this to me.
It will be my pleasure.
Their weapons will not defend them from my wrath.
It will be my pleasure.
I know the same tricks they know; they won't be a problem.
I'll handle it myself.
I'll do whatever you want if the payoff's high enough.
It will be my pleasure.
They won't underestimate the Empire ever again.
It will be my pleasure.
I look forward to seeing your methods in action.
I'll do it, but I'll need a squad.
I'll need troop support.
Command has ordered against a frontal assault--the Rattataki can resist that too easily. You'll have to go alone.
You'll need to take out both the leaders and the machines in the factory--there can be no chance of them rebuilding.
Go yourself. [Refuse quest]
Of course, it was foolish of me to interrupt you. I simply thought you might enjoy the pleasure of handling it yourself.
The prisoners are taking out their vengeance on the Republic. The mynocks are coming home to roost, and we get front row seats.
